intro: Rosa canina f. mixta, commonly known as the hybrid dog rose, is a botanical variant of the common dog rose, Rosa canina. It is characterized by its variable flower color, typically ranging from pale yellow to deep pink, and its thorny stems. The plant produces oval, red-orange hips that are rich in vitamin C and often used in herbal remedies. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in hedgerows and woodland edges. Its foliage is dark green and leathery, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens.
